bestBHT.bht: May grace and peace be multiplied to you, coming from God our Father. It is significant to observe that Jesus Christ is presented as being equal to God, though not identical. Jesus Christ, alongside God, is the ultimate giver of these blessings. As recipients of this abundance, we can find solace in knowing that grace and peace flow from both God the Father and Jesus Christ.

Archibald T. Robertson: In both cases Jesus Christ is put on a par with God, though not identical.
Difference between εν, in the sphere of, by the power of, and απο, from, as the fountain head and source of grace and peace.
Jesus Christ is put on a par with God.
John Gill: Grace be unto you, and peace,....

bhtAttempts.bht: May grace and peace be multiplied to you from God our Father. In this verse, the inclusion of from God our Father emphasizes the source of grace and peace. It is important to note that Jesus Christ is placed on the same level as God, indicating his divine nature. While there is a distinction between the power and authority of Jesus Christ and that of God, they are still connected as the fountainhead of grace and peace. As believers, we can find comfort in the knowledge that these blessings are bestowed upon us by both God the Father and Jesus Christ.
